TopicTitle: KSP Theme plays when nearing Mun surface

Articles.Content: So. I was playing on KSP when I was doing a tutorial on on getting orbit around the mun, I decided to Hyperedit myself there, thus completing the tutorial. Then I used the MunshotA ship to go to the surface of the mun, but i couldn't because I couldnt turn a engine off. So it was like a mass relay because the all engines were on and I couldnt turn any off. Then the most epic thing happened. The KSP theme somehow played. and I managed to shut off the engine. I failed to land on the mun though. Has anyone else had the KSP theme play at a time in space or whatever?

I noticed there was music playing on the way down to Mun on my first manned mission.

Didn't really click at the time, but it's pretty cool now that you mention it!
An SSTV signal plays out at 70,000 petameters from Kerbol.....

Easter egg?

And I really do want to see proof of that deep-space SSTV signal, because I've been there, and farther, and never heard a peep.

Easter egg?

And I really do want to see proof of that deep-space SSTV signal, because I've been there, and farther, and never heard a peep.

I've heard it and I think it happens randomly, I sent 3 probes, and only whe one crossed the boundary did I hear it, when I switched to the other ones to check and then switched back, it was gone. And (I'm not sure if it's still there) there was an Easter egg in 0.14 where if your kerbals went beyond 10Em, their names changed to god Kerman.

Hm. I just used a soundtrack editor to replace a few files. and I was shocked at what I found:

Kerbal Space Program\GameData\SoundtrackEditor\Settings.txt

When I took a look at the space ambience section, I saw this.

SpacePlaylist

{

track = KSP_MainTheme

I then replaced the other space playlist files to play the theme except for Arcadia, which I liked.

Time to head to space for pure epicness!

BTW If anyone wants to have the Soundtrack editor (its for KSP 23.5 but works with 2.4 and the revision update) here is a link: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/65726-0-23-5-Soundtrack-Editor
